column1: Common Bond Bistro & Bakery - Montrose////Menu: we got the boudin potato salad and the chicken torta. I personally prefer the torta because it was more like a burger
column2: the flavors were bold and fresh
column4: and the portion was a good size. It came with a side of pickles which I believe we're made in house (not sure if I really liked the pickles). The boudin was decent
column5: but I wasn't a big fan of the flavors. For someone who grew up in the south
column6: maybe I have higher standards for boudin
column7: so this wasn't my favorite dish. We ended up picking these 2 dishes because most everything else on their menu was sold out
